summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discussing outreach to an individual named Osborne to discuss the upcoming Epstein operation. It indicates coordination between the Public Corruption Unit and federal agents.

persons.name: Osborne
persons.role: Individual to be contacted regarding Epstein operation
persons.context: The email proposes reaching out to Osborne to meet and discuss the upcoming Epstein operation. The sender suggests asking Osborne to meet this week.

events.title: Planned Outreach to Osborne
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office team proposes reaching out to an individual named Osborne to discuss the upcoming Epstein operation.

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The email is dated June 11, 2019, indicating ongoing planning for an Epstein-related operation at that time.
The communication originates from the Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The email discusses a proposed timeline that has been conveyed to federal agents.
The primary action item is to transparently reach out to an individual named Osborne to schedule a meeting about the Epstein operation.
The location of the office is noted as 1 St. Andrew's Plaza.
